scheme_name: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: Subsidy for Work Force Welfare Assistance
description: The Banglashree scheme in West Bengal provides subsidies to MSMEs for workforce welfare measures, such as health insurance, safety equipment, and training. It aims to improve employee well-being and productivity in MSMEs.
key_features: Support for employee health and safety

benefits.subsidy: Up to Rs. 2 Lakhs per MSME for workforce welfare measures

business_criteria: Must be a registered MSME as per the MSME Development Act, 2006
Must be located in West Bengal
operational_criteria: Must implement workforce welfare measures like health insurance or safety equipment
Must have a minimum of 5 employees

eligible_activities: Providing health insurance or medical benefits to employees

steps: Visit the West Bengal MSME portal or Banglashree scheme website
Submit an online application with details of welfare measures
Upload required documents, including MSME registration and expense details
Applications are reviewed by the District Industries Centre (DIC)
Approved applicants receive the subsidy upon verification
application_process.note: Applicants must provide proof of welfare measure implementation

special_notes: The subsidy is limited to approved welfare measures
MSMEs must maintain records of employee benefits
Priority is given to MSMEs with high employee retention
